Title: Evaluation of Nitrous Oxide Emission from Sulfide- and Sulfur-Based Autotrophic Denitrification Processes
Authors: Yiwen Liu, Lai Peng, Huu Hao Ngo, Wenshan Guo, Dongbo Wang, Yuting Pan, Jing Sun, and Bing-Jie Ni
Abstract: Recent studies have shown that sulfide- and sulfur-based autotrophic denitrification (AD) processes play an important role in contributing to nitrous oxide (N2O) production and emissions. However, N2O production is not recognized in the current AD models, limiting their ability to predict N2O accumulation during AD. In this work, a mathematical model is developed to describe N2O dynamics during sulfide- and sulfur-based AD processes for the first time. The model is successfully calibrated and validated using N2O data from two independent experimental systems with sulfide or sulfur as electron donors for AD. The model satisfactorily describes nitrogen reductions, sulfide/sulfur oxidation, and N2O accumulation in both systems. Modeling results revealed substantial N2O accumulation due to the relatively low N2O reduction rate during both sulfide- and sulfur-based AD processes. Application of the model to simulate long-term operations of activated sludge systems performing sulfide- and sulfur-based AD processes indicates longer sludge retention time reduced N2O emission. For sulfide-based AD process, higher initial S/N ratio also decreased N2O emission but with a higher operational cost. This model can be a useful tool to support process operation optimization for N2O mitigation during AD with sulfide or sulfur as electron donor.
GEMINI_What_problem_does_this_paper_atte: - Sulfide- and sulfur-based autotrophic denitrification (AD) processes produce significant amounts of nitrous oxide ($N_2O$), a potent greenhouse gas. - Current mathematical models for AD only describe it as a one-step or two-step denitrification process without considering $N_2O$ accumulation. - There is a lack of mathematical models capable of predicting $N_2O$ dynamics and emissions during sulfide- and sulfur-based AD processes.
GEMINI_How_the_paper_solves_this_problem: - Developed a new mathematical model incorporating a three-step denitrification process ($NO_3^-$ to $N_2$ via $NO_2^-$ and $N_2O$) and a two-step sulfide oxidation process ($S^{2-}$ to $S^0$ and $S^0$ to $SO_4^{2-}$). - Calibrated and validated the model using two independent experimental datasets with highly different conditions (sulfide-based and sulfur-based AD). - Applied the model to simulate long-term operations to investigate the effects of operational parameters like Sludge Retention Time (SRT) and Sulfur/Nitrogen (S/N) ratio on $N_2O$ emissions.
GEMINI_What_experiments_were_done_for_th: - The paper itself primarily focuses on mathematical modeling, but it utilized experimental data from previous studies. - Batch Test I (Sulfide-based): Investigated $N_2O$ accumulation under two different granule sizes (700 $\mu m$ and 1350 $\mu m$) of sulfide-based autotrophic denitrifying sludge. - Batch Test II (Sulfide-based): Investigated $N_2O$ reduction under different initial S/N ratios (0.8, 2.5, 5.0) with 700 $\mu m$ granular sludge. - Batch Tests (Sulfur-based): Conducted with different initial $NO_3^-$ concentrations (30-50 mg N/L) using an enriched autotrophic denitrifying culture and elemental sulfur.
GEMINI_What_are_the_points_that_can_be_e: - The effect of simultaneous heterotrophic and autotrophic denitrification processes on $N_2O$ emissions, especially when external carbon is added to control sulfate formation. - The impact of pH variations on free nitrous acid formation and its subsequent inhibition on the AD process and $N_2O$ accumulation. - Integration of the developed model with standard ASM-based heterotrophic denitrifying $N_2O$ models for comprehensive wastewater treatment plant simulations.
GEMINI_Summarize_the_main_points_of_the_: - A novel mathematical model was successfully developed to describe $N_2O$ dynamics in both sulfide- and sulfur-based AD processes. - The model accurately captures nitrogen reductions, sulfide/sulfur oxidation, and $N_2O$ accumulation. - Substantial $N_2O$ accumulation occurs during the initial stages of AD due to relatively low autotrophic $N_2O$ reduction rates. - Increasing the Sludge Retention Time (SRT) substantially reduces $N_2O$ emissions in both sulfide- and sulfur-based systems. - Higher initial S/N ratios decrease $N_2O$ emissions in sulfide-based AD but lead to incomplete sulfide oxidation and higher operational costs.

zh_Abstract: 近期研究表明，基于硫化物和单质硫的自养反硝化（AD）过程在氧化亚氮（$N_2O$）的产生和排放中起着重要作用。然而，目前的AD模型并未包含$N_2O$的产生过程，限制了它们预测AD过程中$N_2O$积累的能力。本研究首次开发了一个数学模型来描述基于硫化物和单质硫的AD过程中的$N_2O$动态。该模型利用以硫化物或单质硫作为AD电子供体的两个独立实验系统的$N_2O$数据进行了成功的校准和验证。该模型令人满意地描述了两个系统中的氮还原、硫化物/硫氧化以及$N_2O$积累。建模结果显示，由于在基于硫化物和单质硫的AD过程中$N_2O$还原速率相对较低，导致了大量的$N_2O$积累。应用该模型模拟执行基于硫化物和单质硫的AD过程的活性污泥系统的长期运行，结果表明较长的污泥停留时间减少了$N_2O$的排放。对于基于硫化物的AD过程，较高的初始S/N比也降低了$N_2O$排放，但运行成本更高。该模型可以作为一个有用的工具，支持以硫化物或单质硫为电子供体的AD过程中为减少$N_2O$排放而进行的工艺运行优化。
GEMINI_zh_What_problem_does_this_paper_a: - 基于硫化物和单质硫的自养反硝化（AD）过程会产生大量的温室气体氧化亚氮（$N_2O$）。 - 现有的AD数学模型仅将其描述为一步或两步反硝化过程，未考虑$N_2O$的积累。 - 缺乏能够预测基于硫化物和单质硫的AD过程中$N_2O$动态和排放的数学模型。
GEMINI_zh_How_the_paper_solves_this_prob: - 开发了一个新的数学模型，结合了三步反硝化过程（$NO_3^-$ 经 $NO_2^-$ 和 $N_2O$ 还原为 $N_2$）和两步硫氧化过程（$S^{2-}$ 氧化为 $S^0$，$S^0$ 氧化为 $SO_4^{2-}$）。 - 利用来自不同条件（基于硫化物和基于单质硫的AD）的两个独立实验数据集对模型进行了校准和验证。 - 应用该模型模拟长期运行，以研究污泥停留时间（SRT）和硫/氮（S/N）比等操作参数对$N_2O$排放的影响。
GEMINI_zh_What_experiments_were_done_for: - 本文主要侧重于数学建模，但使用了前期研究中的实验数据。 - 批次实验 I（基于硫化物）：研究了两种不同颗粒大小（700 $\mu m$ 和 1350 $\mu m$）的硫化物自养反硝化污泥下的$N_2O$积累情况。 - 批次实验 II（基于硫化物）：研究了700 $\mu m$ 颗粒污泥在不同初始S/N比（0.8, 2.5, 5.0）下的$N_2O$还原情况。 - 批次实验（基于单质硫）：使用富集的自养反硝化菌群和单质硫，在不同初始 $NO_3^-$ 浓度（30-50 mg N/L）下进行测试。
GEMINI_zh_What_are_the_points_that_can_b: - 同步异养和自养反硝化过程对$N_2O$排放的影响，特别是在添加外部碳源以控制硫酸盐生成的情况下。 - pH值变化对游离亚硝酸形成的影响，及其随后对AD过程和$N_2O$积累的抑制作用。 - 将本研究开发的模型与标准的基于ASM的异养反硝化$N_2O$模型相集成，以实现对污水处理厂整体$N_2O$动态的全面模拟。
GEMINI_zh_Summarize_the_main_points_of_t: - 成功开发了一种新型数学模型，用于描述基于硫化物和单质硫的AD过程中的$N_2O$动态。 - 该模型准确地捕捉了氮还原、硫化物/硫氧化以及$N_2O$的积累过程。 - 由于自养$N_2O$还原速率相对较低，在AD过程的初始阶段会发生大量的$N_2O$积累。 - 增加污泥停留时间（SRT）可以大幅减少基于硫化物和单质硫系统中的$N_2O$排放。 - 较高的初始S/N比可降低基于硫化物的AD过程中的$N_2O$排放，但会导致硫化物氧化不完全并增加运行成本。
